Temporary Utils

Will be removed on next fastcore release

{% raw %}

globtastic[source]

globtastic(path:Union[Path, str], recursive:bool=True, symlinks:bool=True, file_glob:str=None, file_re:str=None, folder_re:str=None, skip_file_glob:str=None, skip_file_re:str=None, skip_folder_re:str=None)

A more powerful glob, including regex matches, symlink handling, and skip parameters

Parameters:

  • path : typing.Union[pathlib.Path, str]

    path to start searching

  • recursive : <class 'bool'>, optional

    search subfolders

  • symlinks : <class 'bool'>, optional

    follow symlinks?

  • file_glob : <class 'str'>, optional

    Only include files matching glob

  • file_re : <class 'str'>, optional

    Only include files matching regex

  • folder_re : <class 'str'>, optional

    Only enter folders matching regex

  • skip_file_glob : <class 'str'>, optional

    Skip files matching glob

  • skip_file_re : <class 'str'>, optional

    Skip files matching regex

  • skip_folder_re : <class 'str'>, optional

    Skip folders matching regex

Returns:

  • <class 'fastcore.foundation.L'>

    Paths to matched files

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

compile_re[source]

compile_re(pat)

Compile pat if it's not None

Parameters:

  • pat : <class 'inspect._empty'>
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

walk[source]

walk(path:Path'>, <class 'str'>), symlinks:bool=True, keep_file:callable=noop, keep_folder:callable=noop, func:callable=join)

Generator version of os.walk, using functions to filter files and folders

Parameters:

  • path : (<class 'pathlib.Path'>, <class 'str'>)

    path to start searching

  • symlinks : <class 'bool'>, optional

    follow symlinks?

  • keep_file : <built-in function callable>, optional

    function that returns True for wanted files

  • keep_folder : <built-in function callable>, optional

    function that returns True for folders to enter

  • func : <built-in function callable>, optional

    function to apply to each matched file

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

Constants

Column names from Kaggle Brain Tumor DICOM files

DICOM Processing

Returns the metadata of a single dicom file as a dictionary.

{% raw %}

get_dicom_metadata[source]

get_dicom_metadata(path_to_dicom_file:str, meta_cols:list)

Returns the metadata of a single dicom file as a dictionary.

Parameters:

  • path_to_dicom_file : <class 'str'>

    path to the dicom file

  • meta_cols : <class 'list'>

    list of metadata columns to extract from the dicom file

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
sample_file = globtastic(TINY_DATA_PATH, file_glob='*.*dcm*')[0]
dicom_metadata = get_dicom_metadata(sample_file, kaggle_braintumor_meta_cols)
assert type(dicom_metadata) == dict
{% endraw %}

Retrieve metadata for each BraTS21ID and return as a dataframe.

Returns the correct patient id of a dicom file.

{% raw %}

get_patient_id[source]

get_patient_id(patient_id:int)

Returns a patient id as a string, formatted as the Kaggle Brain Tumor competition data expects e.g 20 will return 00020

Parameters:

  • patient_id : <class 'int'>

    patient id of the dicom file

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
assert get_patient_id(1) == '00001'
{% endraw %}

Get path to patient folder

{% raw %}

get_patient_BraTS21ID_path[source]

get_patient_BraTS21ID_path(row, path:str)

Construct the path to a patient id folder from a DataFrame row

Parameters:

  • row : <class 'inspect._empty'>

    Row from a DataFrame

  • path : <class 'str'>

    Path to patient folders, e.g. could be "train" or "test"

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
TRAIN_PATH = TINY_DATA_PATH/'train'
train_df = pd.read_csv(TINY_DATA_PATH/'train_labels.csv')
# This assertion fails in a Windows system due to path with \\
# assert get_patient_BraTS21ID_path(train_df.iloc[0], TRAIN_PATH) == 'data\\tiny\\train/00000/'
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

get_all_dicom_metadata[source]

get_all_dicom_metadata(df, meta_cols:list, scan_types:list=['FLAIR', 'T1w', 'T1wCE', 'T2w'])

Reads dicom files and returns a dataframe of all dicom metadata, for each BraTS21ID id and each scan type folder.

Parameters:

  • df : <class 'inspect._empty'>

    DataFrame with patient folder ids and BraTS21IDs

  • meta_cols : <class 'list'>

    List of metadata columns to extract

  • scan_types : <class 'list'>, optional

    List of strings of mdedical scan types, default: ['FLAIR', 'T1w', 'T1wCE', 'T2w']

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
data_patient_path = TRAIN_PATH / os.listdir(TRAIN_PATH)[0]

# construct path based on csv and TRAIN_PATH
train_df['path'] = train_df.apply(lambda row: get_patient_BraTS21ID_path(row, TRAIN_PATH), axis=1)

folder_exists = train_df['path'] == str(data_patient_path)+'/'
train_df = train_df[folder_exists]

# Again failing because of windows path issue
# assert len(train_df) >= 1
# assert len(get_all_dicom_metadata(train_df, kaggle_braintumor_meta_cols)) == 8
{% endraw %}
